did.head: Brief Description of the Collection

address.addressline: Special Collections, University of Maryland Libraries, Hornbake Library, College Park, MD 20742. Tel: 301-405-9212, Fax: 301-314-2709, Email: askhornbake@umd.edu

did.physloc: Television and Radio Station Files:3rd floor:32:A:3rd floor 32 : A :
did.abstract: The station files consist of a range of materials, including clippings, promotional brochures, pamphlets, and market data from radio and television stations throughout the United States. The collection was created to facilitate research on specific TV and radio stations.

The station files consist of a range of materials, including clippings, promotional brochures, pamphlets, and market data from radio and television stations throughout the United States. The collection was created to facilitate research on specific TV and radio stations.

The station files consist of a range of materials, including clippings, promotional brochures, pamphlets, and market data from radio and television stations throughout the United States. The collection was created to facilitate research on specific TV and radio stations.

descgrp.head: Important Information for Users of the Collection

accessrestrict.head: Use and Access to Collection
accessrestrict.p: There are no restricted files in this collection.

acqinfo.head: Custodial History and Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: These station files were compiled from a variety of collections that were originally part of the Broadcast Pioneers Library

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Television and Radio Station Files, Special Collections, University of Maryland Libraries.

userestrict.head: Duplication and Copyright Information
userestrict.p: Photocopies of original materials may be provided for a fee and at the discretion of the curator. Please see our Duplication of Materials policy for more information. Queries regarding publication rights and copyright status of materials within this collection should be directed to the appropriate curator.

bioghist.head: Administrative History
bioghist.p: William Hedges, one of the primary architects of American broadcasting, spearheaded the Broadcast Pioneers History Project beginning in 1964, when he and his colleagues began gathering materials that would become the Broadcast Pioneers Library (BPL). Catharine Heinz, former librarian of the Television Information Office and director of the BPL from 1971-1994, created the television and station files from a variety of collections that were part of the BPL.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: The station files consist of a range of materials, including clippings, promotional brochures, pamphlets, and market data from radio and television stations throughout the United States. The collection was created to facilitate research on specific TV and radio stations. This collection is arranged alphabetically by station call letters.

arrangement.p: This collection is arranged in 1 series.

list.item: Series 1: Television and Radio Station Files

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: For other related archival and manuscript collections, please see the following subject guides.

controlaccess.head: Selected Search Terms
controlaccess.p: This collection is indexed under the following headings in the University of Maryland Libraries' Catalog. Researchers desiring related materials about these topics, names, or places may search the Catalog using these headings.

scopecontent.p: The station files consist of a range of materials, including clippings, promotional brochures, pamphlets, and market data from radio and television stations throughout the United States. This series is organized by station call letters.
